title.text: Squibs and Discussions Aligning Phonetic Segments Articulation Assessment for Children's

entities.text: Squibs and Discussions Aligning Phonetic Segments Articulation Assessment

abstractContent.text: Ina recent paper published in this journal (Covington 1996), an algorithm is described which aligns segments within a pair of words for the purpose of identifying historical cognates.
This algorithm could have a further application in the field of speech therapy, and in particular in the practice of articulation assessment of young children.
The present author developed a similar algorithm some years ago for this purpose.
In this paper, we explore some points of comparison between the two applications.
